Homework Instructions

The goal of this class is to help you find something you enjoy doing in technology, whether that be design, coding, networks, databases or even an area of technology we don't cover in this class.

During class we will cover what is listed above for each class and I expect you to fully participate and be engaged with the material.

However, the purpose of the material covered in class is not for you to become expert in it. It is simply to see if this is an area of technology you might enjoy working in in the future.

Therefore what this class is really about is helping you find a passion that may eventually become your career or maybe just a hobby.

To that end, your homework each week is to spend 1-3 hours outside of class doing something you find interesting about technology. It could have nothing to do at all with what we covered in the last class or any class. It may be the same project every week for the whole semester, a new project every week, or even multiple projects in one week. You choose what you want to work on each week.

During those 1-3 hours, or at the very end, I want you to document the work you've done. It doesn't matter to me if you write it down and take a picture of it, type it out in a Google Doc or Sheet, take a video, record yourself talking, anything at all. Feel free to be creative with how you document the time you've spent on your homework.

To submit your documentation, go to Google Classroom and find the link for the most recent class and upload your documentation.

Submissions will be judged on the extent to which they show 1-3 hours of effort were spent on project work. You may not reuse a project from another class. Extra credit will be given if the documentation shows mistakes that were made and how you learned from those mistakes. Working in technology means making lots of mistakes and learning from them so the more you show that, the more points you get.
